meanings.definition: A type of desert landscape characterized by rocky plateaus and sparse vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The explorers trekked through the vast hamadas, feeling the heat of the sun on their backs.
meanings.sent2: The hamadas stretched out endlessly, with only a few hardy plants dotting the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent3: The camels decided to have a race across the hamadas, kicking up dust clouds as they went.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hamadas of thoughts, each one a rocky plateau waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the hamadas was breathtaking, a harsh yet mesmerizing landscape.

meanings.definition: Plural form of hamada, referring to multiple instances of the desert landscape.
meanings.sent1: The expedition encountered various hamadas during their journey, each one unique in its rocky features.
meanings.sent2: The travelers marveled at the vastness of the hamadas, wondering what secrets lay hidden within.
meanings.sent3: The hamadas seemed to whisper tales of ancient civilizations lost in the sands of time.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like the hamadas, solid and enduring despite the harsh conditions.
meanings.sent5: The hamadas stood as silent witnesses to the passage of time, unmoved by the changing world around them.
